content.description:
Go up the small pillars then go straight up to a series of 3 bolts with a small patch of ice and very chossy rock until you reach the trees or traverse right like the original route on a series of chossy ledge full of turf and some very small ice patches with no real protection, you can bring cams and pitons but would definitly not trust them for a safe fall.



in the middle of the amphitheatre you just can't miss it 


Ice screws, cams and 3 or 4 bolts depending of your line.

LEAVE ALL FIXED GEAR IN PLACE.

The route is located on the side of the road, about 100 meters west of the Diagovent pillar. It climbs in the middle of the face, between two rotten dihedrals. Starts in a little overhanging corner. Easy top rope accessibility. The route is protected with bolts and permanent draws. A stickclip is strongly recommended for the first bolt. Be sure to climb when it's under 0 degree celsius to avoid most of the rockfall!



On the side of the 132 road, between the villages of La Martre and Marsoui.

100 meter west of the Diagovent pillar

Coordinates : 49.21116954273968, -66.12222687325439


Bolts and permadraws. Bring 5 draws. 

STICKCLIPPING THE FIRST  BOLT IS RECOMMENDED

Cliff band which is 20 to 30 meters high by the side of the road. It is home of the very nice Diagovent pillar and a couple other mixed lines. The area is in developpement by local climbers who are currently bolting the mixed lines.

BECAUSE OF THE CHOSSY NATURE OF THE ROCK AND THE UNPREDICTABLE QUANTITY/QUALITY OF THE ICE ON THE DIFFERENT LINES BOLT CAN SOMETIME BE PRETTY FAR APART OR EXTENDED WITH SEMI-PERMANENT SLINGS WITH BINERS OR QUICKLINK. MAKE SURE TO LEAVE ALL FIXED/EXISTING GEAR IN PLACE.
